name: Nyama Choma
description: Nyama Choma, which means 'grilled meat' in Swahili, is a beloved Kenyan barbecue dish typically made with goat meat, though beef or chicken can also be used. It is often enjoyed at social gatherings and served with kachumbari and Ugali.
steps: Marinate the meat in a mixture of lemon juice, garlic, ginger, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Prepare a charcoal grill or preheat a gas grill.
Grill the meat over medium heat, turning regularly, until well browned and cooked to desired doneness.
Rest the meat for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve with kachumbari (a fresh tomato and onion salad) and Ugali.
ingredients: 1 kg goat meat, cut into chunks (beef or chicken can also be used)
tips: Ensure the grill is hot before adding the meat to get a good sear.
Keep basting the meat with the leftover marinade to keep it moist and flavorful.
Nyama Choma is best enjoyed freshly grilled and hot.
